p: The effective sequences were clustered into operational taxonomic units (OTUs) using 97% similarity cutoff with UPARSE, which is a method with a focus on reducing OTU inflation. The OTU number range for all five samples was 427 to 870 OTUs using a distance cutoff level of 3% (Table 1). The BM5 sample contained the lowest OUT number. Diversity was highest in the BM4 sample and the lowest in BM5 sample (Table 1, Fig. 1). The Shannon diversity index also revealed that the BM5 sample had the lowest bacterial diversity among the five samples (Table 1). The rarefaction curves of the five samples did not reach a plateau, indicating that the data did not contain enough sequence depth to ascertain the full bacterial diversity (Fig. 1).
